page.title: 04Education in PAUNTLEY
page.content:
{Pauntley C.E. Primary School}(grid ref 37312292) stands on the old Parish Boundary, marked by the old{Boundary {Oak tree,}in the hamlet of Pool Hill. It is a tiny two-roomed Victorian building to which has been added a small kitchen, which doubles as an office, and a separate toilet block.
Approximately ten years ago the school was threatened with{closure}when pupil numbers fell to 16. Public opinion changed Gloucestershire Education Committee's decision. Now there are 38 pupils. Under present policy there is no threat but with continual changes in Governments and policies nothing is certain.
Pupils come from a wide area, not just Pauntley Parish.
